intro: Tetraneuris argentea, commonly known as silverleaf tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-white foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Tetraneuris argentea is an evergreen perennial that can reach heights of up to 30 inches, making it a distinctive feature in its native landscape.
